title: Senior Software Integration Engineer
summary: Are you a fearless thinker? Do you love the challenge of advancing a widely accepted technology? In the Wireless Software group, you’ll be responsible for bringing groundbreaking wireless connectivity to the world through Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, and more. You’ll design, develop, and patent the next generation of our state-of-the art connectivity technologies. You’ll collaborate across departments to help craft wireless solutions that elevate the customer experience with Apple products and services.
description: This role requires the candidate to support and complete the integration plans defined daily, weekly, and monthly. It involves working with the various software, firmware, hardware, SW/FW integration, and QA Teams as well as cross functional collaborations to build consensus. This role also requires understanding of software/firmware dependencies on different hardware/software components. Success in this role is clearly defined by forward movement of the development efforts towards preset milestones and can be measured via integration and QA milestones daily. Some of the responsibilities in this role include but not limited to: - Execute on short term/long term integration plans for product integration of components while working with various software, firmware, hardware, SW/FW integration, and QA Teams. - Executing and adapting the plan to the realities of daily execution around IP deliverables.
key_qualifications: 5+ Years demonstrated ability in integrating complex embedded system hardware, software, and firmware components. Ability to work with QA, Software integration, SW/FW Development and leadership for feature integration plans. Demonstrated ability to drive Several SW/FW components to deliver on schedule, and to build complex embedded chipset products. Depth of knowledge in at least one technology area is expected in cellular/wireless. Self-motivated and comfortable with spanning across software, hardware, systems and commercialization.
education_experience: Bachelor's or Master's degree in EE/CS or relevant experience.
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $135,400 and $250,600, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation.
